blocks.name: cjval
blocks.content: The value of the conjugate of a complex number. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm cjval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(ccj, c0), crio(s0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), cr)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, ccj, crio(s0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), cr))), crio(s0, cc, wa(wcel(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(s0))), cr))))
  riotabidv(s0, cc, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wcel(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(s0))), cr)), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), cr)))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(s0))), cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), cr))
  eleq1d(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(s0)), cr, co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c0, caddc, cv(s0))
  eleq1d(co(ci, cmul, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(s0))), cr, co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq2d(ci, cmul, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(s0)), co(c0, cmin, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c0, cmin, cv(s0))
  df-cj(hs0, s0)
  riotaex(s0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), cr)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(crio(s0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(s0))), cr))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cjval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(* ` c0)= iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((c0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](c0[-]s0))∈ ℝ)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, ccj, iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((c0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](c0[-]s0))∈ ℝ)), iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](hs0[-]s0))∈ ℝ)))
  riotabidv(s0, cc, hs0 = c0, ((hs0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](hs0[-]s0))∈ ℝ), ((c0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](c0[-]s0))∈ ℝ))
  anbi12d(hs0 = c0, (hs0[+]s0)∈ ℝ, (i[×](hs0[-]s0))∈ ℝ, (c0[+]s0)∈ ℝ, (i[×](c0[-]s0))∈ ℝ)
  eleq1d((hs0[+]s0), cr, (c0[+]s0), hs0 = c0)
  oveq1(hs0, c0, caddc, s0)
  eleq1d((i[×](hs0[-]s0)), cr, (i[×](c0[-]s0)), hs0 = c0)
  oveq2d(ci, cmul, (hs0[-]s0), (c0[-]s0), hs0 = c0)
  oveq1(hs0, c0, cmin, s0)
  df-cj(hs0, s0)
  riotaex(s0, cc, ((c0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](c0[-]s0))∈ ℝ))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((c0[+]s0)∈ ℝ ∧(i[×](c0[-]s0))∈ ℝ)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: cjth
blocks.content: The defining property of the complex conjugate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm cjth(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0))), cr)))
} = {
  sylib(wcel(c0, cc), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0))), cr)), wsbc(hs0, cfv(ccj, c0), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))))
  mpbird(wcel(c0, cc), wsbc(hs0, cfv(ccj, c0), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))), wsbc(hs0, crio(hs0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))))
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wsbc(hs0, crio(hs0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))), wreu(hs0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))))
  cju(hs0, c0)
  riotasbc(hs0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr)))
  sbceq1d(hs0, cfv(ccj, c0), crio(hs0, cc, wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr))), wcel(c0, cc), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr)))
  cjval(hs0, c0)
  sbcie(hs0, cfv(ccj, c0), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr)), wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0))), cr)))
  fvex(ccj, c0)
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(ccj, c0)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0))), cr))
  eleq1d(co(c0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cr, co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(ccj, c0)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cfv(ccj, c0), c0, caddc)
  eleq1d(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0))), cr, co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0))), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(ccj, c0)))
  oveq2d(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cv(hs0)), co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(ccj, c0)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cfv(ccj, c0), c0, cmin)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ccj, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(c0, cmin, cfv(ccj, c0))), cr)))
}

blocks.name: reval
blocks.content: The value of the real part of a complex number. (Contributed by NM, 9-May-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm reval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cre, c0), co(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cdiv, nat2)))
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, cre, co(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cdiv, nat2), co(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0))), cdiv, nat2))
  oveq1d(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0))), cdiv, nat2, co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  mpdan(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0))), co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0))), wceq(cfv(ccj, cv(hs0)), cfv(ccj, c0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, ccj)
  oveq12(cv(hs0), c0, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0)), cfv(ccj, c0), caddc)
  df-re(hs0)
  ovex(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cdiv, nat2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(co(co(c0, caddc, cfv(ccj, c0)), cdiv, nat2))
}

blocks.name: imre
blocks.content: The imaginary part of a complex number in terms of the real part function. (Contributed by NM, 12-May-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm imre(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cim, c0), cfv(cre, co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0))))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(cim, c0), cfv(cre, co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0)), cfv(cre, co(c0, cdiv, ci)), wcel(c0, cc))
  imval(c0)
  fveq2d(cre, co(c0, cdiv, ci), co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  syl6eq(co(c0, cdiv, ci), co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0), co(co(nat1, cdiv, ci), cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  mp3an23(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(c0, cdiv, ci), co(co(nat1, cdiv, ci), cmul, c0)), wcel(ci, cc), wne(ci, nat0))
  ax-icn()
  ine0()
  divrec2(c0, ci)
  oveq1i(co(nat1, cdiv, ci), cmul, c0, cneg(ci))
  irec()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm imre(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(Im ` c0)=(Re `(-u(i)[×]c0)))
} = {
  eqtrd((Im ` c0), (Re `(-u(i)[×]c0)), (Re `(c0[÷]i)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  imval(c0)
  fveq2d(cre, (c0[÷]i), (-u(i)[×]c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  syl6eq((c0[÷]i), (-u(i)[×]c0), ((1[÷]i)[×]c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  mp3an23(c0 ∈ ℂ, (c0[÷]i)=((1[÷]i)[×]c0), i ∈ ℂ, i ≠ 0)
  ax-icn()
  ine0()
  divrec2(c0, ci)
  oveq1i((1[÷]i), cmul, c0, -u(i))
  irec()
}

blocks.name: reim
blocks.content: The real part of a complex number in terms of the imaginary part function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm reim(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cre, c0), cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0))))
} = {
  eqtr2d(cfv(cre, c0), cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0)), cfv(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cdiv, ci)), wcel(c0, cc))
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0)), cfv(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cdiv, ci))), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), cc))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), cc), wcel(ci, cc))
  mulcl(ci, c0)
  imval(co(ci, cmul, c0))
  fveq2d(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cdiv, ci), c0, wcel(c0, cc))
  mp3an23(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cdiv, ci), c0), wcel(ci, cc), wne(ci, nat0))
  ax-icn()
  ine0()
  divcan3(c0, ci)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm reim(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(Re ` c0)=(Im `(i[×]c0)))
} = {
  eqtr2d((Re ` c0), (Im `(i[×]c0)), (Re `((i[×]c0)[÷]i)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  syl(c0 ∈ ℂ, (Im `(i[×]c0))=(Re `((i[×]c0)[÷]i)), (i[×]c0)∈ ℂ)
  mpan(c0 ∈ ℂ, (i[×]c0)∈ ℂ, i ∈ ℂ)
  mulcl(ci, c0)
  imval((i[×]c0))
  fveq2d(cre, ((i[×]c0)[÷]i), c0, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  mp3an23(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((i[×]c0)[÷]i)= c0, i ∈ ℂ, i ≠ 0)
  ax-icn()
  ine0()
  divcan3(c0, ci)
}

blocks.content: The real part of a complex number representation. Definition 10-3.1 of [Gleason] p. 132. (Contributed by NM, 12-May-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm crre(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), c0))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), c0, co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  subeq0d(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  halfcld(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(co(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), cmin, c0), nat0), wcel(co(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), cmin, c0), cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, co(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), cmin, c0)), cr))
  resubcld(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  eqeltrrd(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), cr, cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc))
  reval(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc))
  recl(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  eqeltrd(co(ci, cmul, co(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), cmin, c0)), cr, co(co(co(ci, cmul, ci), cmul, c1), cmin, co(co(ci, cmul, co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cmin, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))))), cdiv, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  3eqtr4d(co(ci, cmul, co(co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), cmin, c0)), co(co(co(ci, cmul, ci), cmul, c1), cmin, co(co(ci, cmul, co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cmin, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))))), cdiv, nat2)), co(ci, cmul, co(co(ci, cmul, c1), cmin, co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cmin, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2))), co(co(ci, cmul, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cmin, co(ci, cmul, co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cmin, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  subdid(ci, co(ci, cmul, c1), co(co(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cmin, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), cdiv, nat2), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))

thm resub(class c0, class c1) {

  readd(c0, cneg(c1))
  oveq2d(cfv(cre, c0), caddc, cfv(cre, cneg(c1)), cneg(cfv(cre, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(cfv(cre, cneg(c1)), cneg(cfv(cre, c1))))
  reneg(c1)
  fveq2d(cre, co(c0, caddc, cneg(c1)), co(c0, cmin, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  negsub(c0, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(co(cfv(cre, c0), caddc, cneg(cfv(cre, c1))), co(cfv(cre, c0), cmin, cfv(cre, c1))), wcel(cfv(cre, c0), cc), wcel(cfv(cre, c1), cc))

} = {

  negsub((Re ` c0), (Re ` c1))
}

blocks.name: cjre
blocks.content: A real number equals its complex conjugate. Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 8-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: cjcj
blocks.content: The conjugate of the conjugate is the original complex number. Proposition 10-3.4(e) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jul-1999.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: cj11
blocks.content: Complex conjugate is a one-to-one function. (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-2005.) (Proof shortened by Eric Schmidt, 2-Jul-2009.)

blocks.name: cjne0
blocks.content: A number is nonzero iff its complex conjugate is nonzero. (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-2005.)

blocks.name: recli
blocks.content: The real part of a complex number is real (closure law). (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.)

blocks.name: imcli
blocks.content: The imaginary part of a complex number is real (closure law). (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.)

blocks.name: cjcli
blocks.content: Closure law for complex conjugate. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.)

blocks.name: replimi
blocks.content: Construct a complex number from its real and imaginary parts. (Contributed by NM, 1-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: cjcji
blocks.content: The conjugate of the conjugate is the original complex number. Proposition 10-3.4(e) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.)

blocks.name: reim0bi
blocks.content: A number is real iff its imaginary part is 0. (Contributed by NM, 29-May-1999.)

blocks.name: rerebi
blocks.content: A real number equals its real part. Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 27-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: cjrebi
blocks.content: A number is real iff it equals its complex conjugate. Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: recji
blocks.content: Real part of a complex conjugate. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: imcji
blocks.content: Imaginary part of a complex conjugate. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: cjmulrcli
blocks.content: A complex number times its conjugate is real. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.)

blocks.name: cjmulvali
blocks.content: A complex number times its conjugate. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: cjmulge0i
blocks.content: A complex number times its conjugate is nonnegative. (Contributed by NM, 28-May-1999.)

blocks.name: renegi
blocks.content: Real part of negative. (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-1999.)

blocks.name: imnegi
blocks.content: Imaginary part of negative. (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-1999.)

blocks.name: cjnegi
blocks.content: Complex conjugate of negative. (Contributed by NM, 2-Aug-1999.)

blocks.name: addcji
blocks.content: A number plus its conjugate is twice its real part. Compare Proposition 10-3.4(h) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: readdi
blocks.content: Real part distributes over addition. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: imaddi
blocks.content: Imaginary part distributes over addition. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: remuli
blocks.content: Real part of a product. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: immuli
blocks.content: Imaginary part of a product. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: cjaddi
blocks.content: Complex conjugate distributes over addition. Proposition 10-3.4(a) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: cjmuli
blocks.content: Complex conjugate distributes over multiplication. Proposition 10-3.4(c) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: ipcni
blocks.content: Standard inner product on complex numbers. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: cjdivi
blocks.content: Complex conjugate distributes over division. (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: crrei
blocks.content: The real part of a complex number representation. Definition 10-3.1 of [Gleason] p. 132. (Contributed by NM, 10-May-1999.)

blocks.name: crimi
blocks.content: The imaginary part of a complex number representation. Definition 10-3.1 of [Gleason] p. 132. (Contributed by NM, 10-May-1999.)

blocks.name: recld
blocks.content: The real part of a complex number is real (closure law). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: imcld
blocks.content: The imaginary part of a complex number is real (closure law). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjcld
blocks.content: Closure law for complex conjugate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: replimd
blocks.content: Construct a complex number from its real and imaginary parts. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: remimd
blocks.content: Value of the conjugate of a complex number. The value is the real part minus ` _i ` times the imaginary part. Definition 10-3.2 of [Gleason] p. 132. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjcjd
blocks.content: The conjugate of the conjugate is the original complex number. Proposition 10-3.4(e) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: reim0bd
blocks.content: A number is real iff its imaginary part is 0. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: rerebd
blocks.content: A real number equals its real part. Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjrebd
blocks.content: A number is real iff it equals its complex conjugate. Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjne0d
blocks.content: A number is nonzero iff its complex conjugate is nonzero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: recjd
blocks.content: Real part of a complex conjugate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: imcjd
blocks.content: Imaginary part of a complex conjugate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjmulrcld
blocks.content: A complex number times its conjugate is real. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjmulvald
blocks.content: A complex number times its conjugate. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjmulge0d
blocks.content: A complex number times its conjugate is nonnegative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: renegd
blocks.content: Real part of negative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: imnegd
blocks.content: Imaginary part of negative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjnegd
blocks.content: Complex conjugate of negative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: addcjd
blocks.content: A number plus its conjugate is twice its real part. Compare Proposition 10-3.4(h) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjexpd
blocks.content: Complex conjugate of positive integer exponentiation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: readdd
blocks.content: Real part distributes over addition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: imaddd
blocks.content: Imaginary part distributes over addition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: resubd
blocks.content: Real part distributes over subtraction. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: imsubd
blocks.content: Imaginary part distributes over subtraction. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: remuld
blocks.content: Real part of a product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: immuld
blocks.content: Imaginary part of a product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjaddd
blocks.content: Complex conjugate distributes over addition. Proposition 10-3.4(a) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjmuld
blocks.content: Complex conjugate distributes over multiplication. Proposition 10-3.4(c) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: ipcnd
blocks.content: Standard inner product on complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjdivd
blocks.content: Complex conjugate distributes over division. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: rered
blocks.content: A real number equals its real part. One direction of Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: reim0d
blocks.content: The imaginary part of a real number is 0. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: cjred
blocks.content: A real number equals its complex conjugate. Proposition 10-3.4(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: remul2d
blocks.content: Real part of a product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: immul2d
blocks.content: Imaginary part of a product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: redivd
blocks.content: Real part of a division. Related to ~ remul2 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: imdivd
blocks.content: Imaginary part of a division. Related to ~ remul2 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: crred
blocks.content: The real part of a complex number representation. Definition 10-3.1 of [Gleason] p. 132. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: crimd
blocks.content: The imaginary part of a complex number representation. Definition 10-3.1 of [Gleason] p. 132. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
